intro: Ammannia ramosior, commonly known as prairie ammannia, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is a member of the Nyctaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds, thriving in moist to wet soil conditions. Its leaves are alternate, oval-shaped, and often have a reddish or purple hue, adding visual interest to its habitat. Ammannia ramosior is also known for its ability to spread through rhizomes, forming dense stands in suitable environments.
